name: I/O Extended 2017 Lafia
description: I/O Extended events bring local developer communities together to experience the I/O keynote and sessions with one another in real-time, around the globe. Extended events also offer unique activities such as hackathons, codelabs, and demos. Ours is a delayed(extended) viewing party where we will be watching all the exciting announcements from both the General Keynote targeted at End Users and business partners as well as the Developers Keynote where  latest news and updates to Google's developer products and platforms will be announced.  We will also be having tech talk sessions from 2 speakers as well as an hour long codelab session. Please do RSVP to attend, see you there.

name: Pre-Devfest Meetup
description: We will be preparing for our participation at #Devfest17 #Abuja. Assembling a team for our hackathon and identifying a problem we will solve. We will also be discussing on our Upcoming Mobile Web/PWA Study Jam.

name: North Central DevFest Abuja
description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more. North Central DevFest 2017 will be organized as a typical DevFest in the Month of November featuring Speakers from our cluster of participating chapters and the community at large to attain a bigger and impactful event in the developer community. Register to attend the event at https://bit.ly/devfestabuja-rsvp. 

More Details on the event and speakers list at https://ncdevfest.com

name: Lets Git The Right Way
description:
• What we'll do
We will discuss how to use version control systems properly, from keeping track of file changes to writing valid commit messages to merging to development branch and resolving merge conflicts.

• What to bring
Laptops, Pen and Papers

• Important to know

name: Mobile Site Study Jam Lafia
description:
As you know, the web is one of our core technology pillars. A key way of educating our community and spreading know how on key technologies like mobile speed, PWA, AMP and web payments is through the Mobile Site Certification Study Jam.

Today over 50% of web traffic goes to mobile yet, developers aren’t designing effectively for it. For example, 53% of mobile visitors will leave if a page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 19 seconds to load over 3G. Speed is just one part of creating better mobile experiences and best practice has gone a long way past responsive design alone. Are you up to date? Join us as we explore ways in which you can design apps that will perform excellently on this set of devices.

name: IWD Lafia 2018
description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

At IWD '18 Lafia we will be sharing our stories and other women who have been making waves in technology, thereby trying to build a new horizon, this way we can encourage other ladies to join the STEM field From Ada Lovelace to Grace Hopper among others. We will also be having a codelab session where participants will get their hands dirty with codelab prepared by the Google Cloud team, so get prepared.

Our schedule is as thus:

09:00 - 09:30am
Registration and Tag Collection
09:30 - 09:45am
Introducing IWD/ WTM/Lesson Learnt from WTM Summit Lagos
09:45 - 10:30am
Tea Break
10:30 - 11:00am
Being a Developer: My Story
11:00 - 11:30am
Women and STEM: Improving Our Numbers
11:30-12:00am
Video Clip from an Inspirational Women in Tech
11:30 - 12:00am
Exploring Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
12:00 - 12:30
Lunch/Networking
12:30 - 2:50pm
GCP Codelabs
2:50-3:00pm
Group picture

name: Google IO18 Extended Lafia
description: Give our community members the opportunity to take part and feel the I/O experience, we will be watching all the exciting announcements from both the General Keynote as well as the Developers Keynote where latest news and updates to Google's developer products and platforms will be announced. We will also be having tech talk sessions from 2 speakers as well as an hour-long codelab session. #io18extended
how_to_find_us: IT Center is at the Permanent site of the school, its positioned left of the school administrative block

name: Pre Devfest Meetup
description: We will be updating members on the preparations ongoing for the North Central Devfest 2018.

name: DevFest Abuja 2018
description: GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, code labs, hackathon and more! #Devfest18 #Abuja will have 5 chapters clustering to make this the best hosted so far, Pictures from #Devfest17 can be found at https://photos.app.goo.gl/ExTDoMdQujsDwV5p1. More details of this event can be found at https://ncdevfest.com

name: Flutter Viewing Party Lafia
description: This is an event that will give attendees to experience the latest from Flutter, Google’s free and open source SDK for building high-quality native iOS and Android apps from a single codebase. We will be looking through the advancement of the Flutter and our attendees will get introduced to building native apps with Flutter

name: DevFest 2018 Lafia
description: The event is the biggest tech event in Lafia, our team works hard to make DevFest to be the best place for experience sharing in a phenomenal atmosphere. We will be featuring contents in software development covering Android, Web and Cloud technologies.
